title: Royal Caribbean Cruises bans woman for life for 'dangerous' onboard photo
text:

A woman has been banned for life from going on a Royal Caribbean cruise after she posed for a 'dangerous' photo on board.

The woman climbed over a balcony railing and was pictured in the precarious position by a fellow passenger, who was shocked at the woman's actions.

The picture shows s a lady in a blue swimsuit striking a pose for the camera in an extremely dangerous spot.

The lady and her companion have since been removed from the Allure of the Seas cruise ship following the incident.

Royal Caribbean have also banned both from using the cruise line again.

(Image: Peter Blosic)

Passenger Peter Blosic took the image and posted it online expressing his anger over the woman's irresponsible actions.

In the now removed post, he said "you cannot fall off of a ship unless you are acting like a moron!".

The man alerted guest services soon after he saw the woman on the edge.

The crew then tracked down the woman and her friend, removing them from the ship when it docked at Falmouth, Jamaica.

"Sitting, standing, laying or climbing on, over or across any exterior or interior railings or other protective barriers, or tampering with ship’s equipment, facilities or systems designed for guest safety is not permitted," Royal Caribbean wrote on their website.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

The lengths people will go to for a good social media post has been a point of issue over recent years, following a number of fatalities.

In 2018, a 20-year-old man, fell to his death attempting to take a photo from the sea cliffs in The Gap near WA's Albany.

In October 2019, a family of four drowned trying to take a selfie at a reservoir in India's Tamil Nadu.
description: The woman and her companion were kicked off the Allure of the Seas cruise ship when it docked at Falmouth, Jamaica
